title: LLM Auditor (Search & Brand Analysis)
description: Generate or use seed commercial prompts, optionally expand competitor brands, and run them across multiple LLM models (with optional live search) to analyse brand presence and rankings.

brands.title: Brands to analyze
brands.description: List of brand names or homepage URLs to analyze. Either brand names (e.g., 'mapfre') or URLs (https://www.mapfre.es). These are usually the clients's own brands. Competitors can be specified separately.

models.title: LLMs to Evaluate
models.description: List of LLM provider/model identifiers to evaluate. If empty, sensible defaults are used (openai/gpt-4.1, google/gemini-2.5-flash). Format: provider/model (e.g., openai/gpt-4.1, google/gemini-2.5-flash).

prompts.title: Seed Prompts
prompts.description: Optional list of initial prompts/questions to include in the analysis. At least one of prompts, sector, or brands must be provided so that the system can generate a more complete prompt list.
prefill: best insurance for freelancers in spain
compare small business liability coverage options

prompts_max.title: Maximum number of prompts to generate
prompts_max.description: Maximum total number of prompts after generation + seeds prompts. Additional prompts are LLM-generated if seeds < this limit and sector or brands context is available.

prompt_intents.title: Intent catgories for generated prompts
prompt_intents.description: Optional list of user intents to focus on when generating additional prompts (e.g., 'commercial', 'navigational', ...). Helps diversify the generated prompts.

prompt_language.title: Prompt Language
prompt_language.description: Language to use when generating additional prompts (e.g., English, Spanish).

brands_in_prompt.title: Include Brands In Generated Prompts
brands_in_prompt.description: Whether generated prompts explicitly mention brand names: never (default), sometimes, or always.

competitors.title: Competitor brands to include in analysis
competitors.description: List of competitor brand names or homepage URLs to analyze. These can be automatically expanded up to competitors_max. Results will show own vs competitor brand presence and rankings.

competitors_max.title: Maximum number of competitor brands
competitors_max.description: Maximum number of competitor brands to include in analysis. If competitors are provided, they are used first, then additional competitors are discovered using search if needed up to this limit.

sector.title: Sector to focus on in prompt generation and competitor discovery
sector.description: Industry / sector context (e.g., insurance, banking, ecommerce). Helps prompt generation and competitor discovery.

market.title: Market/Region to focus on in prompt generation and competitor discovery
market.description: Geographic market focus (e.g., Spain, Germany, US). Used for competitor search and localized prompt generation.

use_search.title: Enable Live Search
use_search.description: If true, uses live search augmentation when querying models. Should be enabled for almost all use cases to improve relevance and factuality. Only disable specifically for testing LLM internal knowledge.

search_country.title: Search Localisation Country Code
search_country.description: Optional country code for search localisation (e.g., 'us', 'uk', 'de'). Helps get results more relevant to the target market. Only currently supported by OpenAI (GPT models), XAI (Grok), and Google's AI Overview (via hasdata API).
